person.persName: John Lucas (Clay County Grocer/Capt 3rd KY Infantry)

body.p: Native of Clay County, Kentucky. Enlisted in the U.S. Army for the Mexican-American War on April 24, 1847. Served in company E of the 16th Kentucky regiment until August 5, 1848. Accepted a captain's commissioner on April 15, 1862 in company B of the 3rd Kentucky Volunteer Infantry at Camp Cumberland Kentucky. Married Maria Williams on October 10, 1854. Worked as a grocer in Clay County in 1860. Also worked as a hotel keeper.

Spouse: Maria Lucas
Children: Delora Lucas, Harvey Lucas, Greene Lucas, Elizabeth Lucas
